website_summaries.verdict: An affordable standard bar that is a step up from beginner-friendly options most choose from the start.
pros: The main center of the bar uses a slight curve to divide the difference between beginner-friendly angled bars and professional-level straight bars
The design offers a good transition step for anyone wanting to progress in technique
cons: Diameter of the lifting bar is not quite at 1inch as advertised

customer_reviews.title: Diameter smaller than other bars. Spring clips slide off
customer_reviews.text: I returned it. Was a solid build but the diameter was slightly smaller than a standard bar normally is. Standard spring clips that fit every bar I have just slide off and don't hold. If I tilt the bar the weights just slide off as the standard clamps won't work.
customer_reviews.author: Sam Seed

customer_reviews.title: Black powder coat bar is very nice.
customer_reviews.text: I bought the black powder coated bar, and it is really nice. The knarling isn't too rough at all, and my clamps fit right on it with no problems. I've read some reviews of the chrome bar flaking, and that's why I wanted the black powder coat, as I've had expirience with this before and found the black powder coat superior. Very nice bar.
customer_reviews.author: Ernest

customer_reviews.title: Great specialized bar for bicep curls and shoulder press
customer_reviews.text: I have both this bar and the other straight bar of the same brand. I use this for bicep curling and overhead shoulder press only (can probably do bent-over rows too, but mostly prefer to use straight bar for that). I like it a lot. The grooves help with the grip and consistent hand placement: For shoulder press, the placement helps with keeping my elbows in check so it doesn't stick outward so much. For Bicep Curls, it is easier on the wrist because the grooves allow you to hold them with hands more supinated.
customer_reviews.author: ACE

customer_reviews.title: Great Curling bar for the price.
customer_reviews.text: I like this E-Z Curl bar because it feels right when holding it in the various hand positions. The chrome plate is pretty average, and no flaking or bad spots were found. The knurling is deep and coarse giving a good grip. I like the hand positions, they are comfortable and not extreme or funky like some other bars. The smooth ends are a blessing when it comes to changing weights. Those bars with the threaded ends waste my time. Smooth bars the collar slides on and a twist locks it in place. Simple and no spinning a locking nut like the other bars. All in all, its a great bar for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Mark42Top Contributor: Cycling

customer_reviews.title: A good curl bar for the price
customer_reviews.text: Using this bar I curl 5 to 71⁄2 lbs. more than I curl with a straight bar. The bar is strong, easy to hold, and the price is good. Note that the diameter is 1" and not 2". Two-inch disks that are used with an "Olympic" bar will not fit. Also, you need 2 clips or clamps that are 1" and not 2". These are not included. The ends of the bar are not threaded for the screw-on type of clamp.

customer_reviews.title: Nothing to complain about, its a solid steel bar that does what it needs to
